answers.text:
Hello, Eric.
This is an ordinance from Mission Hills, KS used to bring above-ground power lines underground.  It puts the city in a position to facilitate the process by finding neighborhoods with willing property owners and then paying the power companies to perform the labor:
http://www.missionhillsks.gov/DocumentCenter/Home/View/719
Here is an article from the city of Frisco, Texas.  It is illegal for them to force the cost of burying the lines on the power company as the company must pass the cost to the consumer but it is illegal for the company to hike the utility rates.  The city proposed to pay the difference themselves:
http://jeffcheney.wordpress.com/2008/08/04/underground-utility-lines/
This is the actual ordinance which was passed:
http://www.ci.frisco.tx.us/departments/publicworks/Documents/ROW--Utility_line_ord.pdf
I hope these help you, or at least provide a baseline for your community's utility burial policy.
Gabe Brehm
Knowledge Network Intern
ICMA

author: Eric Cline
text: Does anyone have a model ordinance that could require utility companies to bury utility lines? A community has asked me to research this but they are unsure of the legality. I am looking for a model ordinance. Any information will be most helpful.
title: Utility Line Burial
